verses.text: 過兩天，就是逾越節和除酵節了，祭司長和經學家設法怎樣用詭計逮捕耶穌，把他殺害。

words.note: Lit. 'overpass festival'.
Lit. 'remove leaven festival'.
Refers to Jewish scholars who interpreted the law.

verses.text: 不過他們說：「不可在節期下手，免得引起民眾暴動。」

words.note: Lit. 'put hand down'.

verses.text: 耶穌在伯大尼，在患痲風的西門家裡吃飯的時候，有一個女人來了，拿著一瓶珍貴的純哪噠香膏。她打破了瓶，把香膏澆在耶穌的頭上。

words.note: A transliteration of 'nard', a fragrant plant used for perfume.

verses.heading: Jesus’ Anointing

verses.text: 有幾個人很生氣，彼此說：「為甚麼這樣浪費香膏呢？
這香膏可以賣三百多個銀幣，用來賙濟窮人。」他們就向她發怒。

words.note: Refers to giving aid, especially to the poor.

verses.text: 但耶穌說：「由她吧！為甚麼難為她呢？她在我身上作的是一件美事。
你們常常有窮人跟你們在一起，只要你們願意，隨時都可以向他們行善，然而你們卻不常有我。
她已經盡她所能的作了。她預先用香膏膏了我的身體，是為了我的安葬。

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，福音無論傳到世界上甚麼地方，都要傳講這女人所作的來記念她。」

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'
Suffix indicating 'on' or 'above', here part of '世界上'.
Indicates the object of the following verb.

verses.text: 十二門徒中的一個，就是加略人猶大，去見祭司長，要把耶穌交給他們。

words.note: Refers to Judas as a 'man from Kerioth' (加略).
Used to prepose the direct object of a verb.

verses.heading: The Plan to Betray Jesus

verses.text: 他們聽見了就很歡喜，答應給他銀子。於是猶大就找機會出賣耶穌。
除酵節的第一天，就是宰殺逾越節羊羔的那一天，門徒問耶穌：「你要我們到哪裡去，為你預備逾越節的晚餐呢？」

words.note: Commemorates the Exodus from Egypt.
Commemorates deliverance from slavery in Egypt.
A follower or student, specifically of Jesus.

verses.heading: The Passover

verses.text: 他就差派兩個門徒，對他們說：「你們到城裡去，必有一個拿著水瓶的人，向你們迎面而來，你們就跟著他，

words.note: To approach face-to-face.

verses.text: 無論他進入哪一家，你們要對那家主說，老師說：『我的客廳在哪裡？我和門徒好在那裡吃逾越節的晚餐。』

words.note: Often used for Jesus as 'Master' or 'Rabbi'.
Functions adverbially here, meaning 'in order to' or 'so that it is convenient'.

verses.text: 他必指給你們樓上一間布置整齊、預備妥當的大房間，你們就在那裡為我們預備。」
門徒出去，進了城，所遇見的正如耶穌所說的，就預備好了逾越節的晚餐。

words.note: Lit. 'gate-student', one who enters a school to become an apprentice.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb, meaning 'what is V-ed'.
Verb complement indicating completion or satisfactory result.
Jewish festival commemorating the Exodus from Egypt.

verses.text: 到了晚上，耶穌和十二門徒來了。

words.note: Here implies 'when it reached' or 'when it was'.

verses.text: 他們坐著吃飯的時候，耶穌說：「我實在告訴你們，你們中間有一個跟我一起吃飯的人要出賣我。」

words.note: Indicates an action in progress or a sustained state.
Can also be a verb meaning 'to follow'.
Lit. 'one rise'.
Often implies betrayal when selling out someone.

verses.text: 他們就很憂愁，一個一個地問他：「是我嗎？」

words.note: Connects an adverbial phrase to a verb.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「他是十二門徒裡的一個，和我一同把手蘸在盤子裡的。

words.note: Often used as a postposition indicating 'in' or 'among'.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

verses.text: 正如經上指著人子所說的，他固然要離世，但出賣人子的那人有禍了！他沒有生下來還好。」

words.note: A title for Jesus Christ.
所 creates a nominal phrase from a verb.
A title for Jesus Christ.
Often translated as 'woe to him'.

verses.text: 他們吃的時候，耶穌拿起餅來，祝謝了，就擘開，遞給門徒，說：「你們拿去吃吧，這是我的身體。」

words.note: Often translated as 'blessed and broke'.

verses.heading: The Lord’s Supper

verses.text: 又拿起杯來，祝謝了就遞給門徒，他們都喝了。
耶穌說：「這是我的血，是為立約的，為許多人流出來的。

words.note: Indicates the resultative action of flowing out.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，我決不再喝這葡萄酒，直到我在 神的國裡喝新酒的那一天。」

words.note: The preceding space is a reverence marker.

verses.text: 他們唱完了詩，就出來，往橄欖山去。

words.note: Refers to a religious song or psalm.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「你們都要後退，因為經上記著：『我要擊打牧人，羊群就分散了。』

words.note: Figurative here for abandoning faith or loyalty.
Common verb, but biblical context of God's action.
Used metaphorically in scripture for leaders or God.
Used metaphorically in scripture for followers.

verses.heading: The Prediction of Peter’s Denial

verses.text: 但我復活以後，要比你們先到加利利去。」
彼得對他說：「就算所有的人都後退，我卻不會。」
耶穌對他說：「我實在告訴你，就在今天晚上，雞叫兩遍以前，你會三次不認我。」
彼得更堅決地說：「就算必須與你一同死，我也決不會不認你！」眾人也都這樣說。

words.note: More formal than '和' (hé).
Here, '不認' means 'to deny'.

verses.text: 他們來到一個地方，名叫客西馬尼；耶穌對門徒說：「你們坐在這裡，我去禱告。」

words.note: Lit. 'door follower' or 'school student'.

verses.heading: Gethsemane

verses.text: 他帶了彼得、雅各、約翰一起去，就驚懼起來，非常難過。

words.note: Used as a directional complement, indicating the start of an action or movement upwards.

verses.text: 於是對他們說：「我的心靈痛苦得快要死了；你們要留在這裡，也要警醒。」

words.note: Often used in religious or philosophical contexts.
Indicates degree or result following a verb/adjective.
More formal than just 'wake up'; implies spiritual vigilance.

verses.text: 耶穌稍往前走，俯伏在地上禱告：如果可能的話，使那時刻不要臨到他。

words.note: More formal than '一點' (yīdiǎn).
Forms '地上' meaning 'on the ground'.
Used in the structure '如果...的話' meaning 'if...'.
Used in the structure '如果...的話' meaning 'if...'.
Used with '不' for a negative imperative.

verses.text: 他說：「阿爸、父啊，你凡事都能作，求你叫這杯離開我。但不要照我的意思，只要照你的旨意。」

words.note: Aramaic for 'Father', used in prayer.
Metaphor for suffering or divine judgment.

verses.text: 耶穌回來，看見門徒睡著了，就對彼得說：「西門，你睡覺嗎？你連一個小時也不能警醒嗎？
應當警醒、禱告，免得陷入試探；你們心靈雖然願意，肉體卻是軟弱的。」

words.note: Lit. 'to tell and appeal'
Can mean 'test' or 'temptation' depending on context.

verses.text: 耶穌又去禱告，說的也是同樣的話。
他再回來的時候，看見門徒睡著了；因為他們十分疲倦，不知道該怎樣回答他。
耶穌第三次回來，對他們說：「你們還在睡覺休息嗎？夠了，時候到了，看哪，人子要被交在罪人手裡了。

words.definition: at, in, indicating action in progress

words.note: Used to draw attention, similar to 'behold' in English.
A title Jesus used for himself in the Gospels.

verses.text: 起來，我們走吧！出賣我的人來了。」
耶穌還在說話的時候，十二門徒中的猶大和一群拿著刀棒的人來到了；他們是祭司長、經學家和長老派來的。

words.definition: at, in, indicating action in progress

words.note: Lit. 'door follower' or 'sect disciple'.
Lit. 'sacrificial officer chief'.
Lit. 'classics scholar'.
Often refers to church leaders in a biblical context.

verses.heading: Betrayal and Arrest

verses.text: 出賣耶穌的人給他們一個暗號，說：「我跟誰親吻，誰就是他。你們把他逮捕，小心帶去。」

words.note: Can refer to a greeting or a sign of affection/betrayal.

verses.text: 猶大來到，立刻上前對耶穌說：「拉比！」就跟他親吻。

words.note: Transliteration of 'Rabbi', meaning teacher or master.
Can refer to a greeting or a sign of affection/betrayal.

verses.text: 他們就動手拿住耶穌，逮捕了他。
站在旁邊的人中有一個拔出刀來，砍了大祭司的僕人一刀，削掉了他的一隻耳朵。

words.note: Indicates movement towards the speaker or reference point.
Here '刀' acts as a measure word for cuts.
隻 is a measure word for animals or body parts (e.g., ears, hands).

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「你們帶著刀棒出來，把我當作強盜捉拿嗎？

words.note: Indicates a continuous state or action.
A general term for weapons used to arrest.
Used to prepose the object of a verb.

verses.text: 我天天在殿裡教導人，跟你們在一起，你們卻沒有捉拿我；但這是為了要應驗經上的話。」

words.note: Refers to the Jerusalem Temple.
Refers to what is written in the sacred texts.

verses.text: 門徒都離開他逃跑了。
有一個青年，赤身披著一塊麻布，跟著耶穌。眾人捉住他的時候，

words.note: Often used in biblical or literary contexts.
Refers to a coarse fabric, often associated with mourning or simple attire in the Bible.

verses.text: 他就丟掉麻布，赤身逃跑了。
他們把耶穌押到大祭司那裡，所有的祭司長、長老和經學家都聚集在一起。

words.note: Indicates the object is acted upon and disposed of.
In a religious context, refers to church elders or leaders.
Refers to Jewish scholars who interpreted and taught the Mosaic Law.

verses.heading: Condemned by the Sanhedrin

verses.text: 彼得遠遠地跟著耶穌，直到大祭司的官邸，和差役一同坐著烤火。

words.note: Refers to subordinates or government servants, often temple guards in this context.

words.definition: to warm oneself by a fire

verses.text: 祭司長和公議會全體都尋找證據控告耶穌，要把他處死，卻沒有找著。

words.note: The supreme judicial council of the ancient Jews.

verses.text: 有許多人作假證供控告他，但他們的證供各不相符。

words.definition: to make, to do, to act as

words.note: Refers to legal testimony given in court or trial.

verses.text: 有幾個人站起來，作假證供控告他說：

words.definition: to make, to do, to act as

verses.text: 「我們聽他說過：『我要拆毀這座人手所造的聖所，三日之內要另建一座不是人手所造的聖所。』」

words.note: Often used in biblical texts to contrast with divine action.
Classical Chinese particle, often forming a passive construction '被...所...'
A more formal or literary way to say 'within'.

verses.text: 就是這樣的見證，他們也不一致。

words.note: Can refer to bearing witness in a religious sense or legal testimony.

verses.text: 大祭司站起來，走到中間，問耶穌：「這些人作證控告你的是甚麼呢？你怎麼不回答呢？」

words.note: The chief priest of ancient Israel.
Often refers to providing evidence or testimony in a legal or religious context.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause, 'that which accuses you'.

verses.text: 耶穌卻不作聲，甚麼也不回答。大祭司又問他：「你是那受稱頌者的兒子基督嗎？」

words.note: Refers to 'the Blessed One' (God).
Suffix forming an agent noun

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我是。你們要看見人子，坐在權能者的右邊，駕著天上的雲降臨。」

words.note: A title Jesus used for himself.
Refers to God, the Almighty.
Often used for divine coming or arrival.

verses.text: 大祭司就撕開自己的衣服，說：「我們還要甚麼證人呢？
你們都聽見這褻瀆的話了。你們認為怎麼樣？」眾人都定他該死的罪。
於是有些人就向他吐唾沫，蒙住他的臉。用拳頭打他，對他說：「你說預言吧！」差役把他拉去，用手掌打他。

words.note: Refers to temple guards or officials.

verses.text: 彼得在下邊院子的時候，大祭司的一個婢女來了，
verses.heading: Peter’s Denials

verses.text: 看見彼得烤火，就瞪著他說：「你也是和拿撒勒人耶穌一夥的！」

words.note: People from Nazareth

verses.text: 彼得卻否認說：「我不知道，也不明白你在說甚麼！」他就走出去，到了前院，雞就叫了（有些抄本無「雞就叫了」一句）。

words.note: Verb with directional complement

verses.text: 那婢女看見他，又對站在旁邊的人說：「這個人也是他們一夥的。」
彼得還是不承認。過了一會，站在旁邊的人也對彼得說：「你真是他們一夥的，因為你也是加利利人。」

words.note: People from Galilee

verses.text: 彼得就發咒起誓說：「我不認得你們說的這個人！」

words.definition: to utter an oath, to curse
words.note: Often combined with '起誓' (qǐshì) to mean 'to swear an oath'.
Often combined with '發咒' (fāzhòu) to mean 'to swear an oath'.

verses.text: 立刻雞就叫了第二遍。彼得想起耶穌對他說過的話：「雞叫兩遍以前，你要三次不認我。」他一想起來，就哭了（「他一想起來，就哭了」或譯：「他就奪步而出，痛哭起來」）。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
Combined verb '說' (shuō) and aspect particle '過' (guo) indicating past experience.
Auxiliary verb indicating intention or necessity.
In this context, 'not recognize' or 'deny'.
Used in the '一...就...' (yī... jiù...) structure.
Used in the '一...就...' (yī... jiù...) structure.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Used in the '一...就...' (yī... jiù...) structure.
Used in the '一...就...' (yī... jiù...) structure.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates an alternative translation.
Often used to describe a rapid, forceful departure.
Often connects two clauses or verb phrases, indicating sequence or result.
Used as a verb complement indicating the beginning of an action or an upward movement.
